title: Anatoly Malykhin heavyweight MMA: Two-division MMA king Anatoly Malykhin reveals heartfelt wish for his family in 2025: "If God wills"
text:

Two-division MMA king Anatoly Malykhin reveals heartfelt wish for his family in 2025: "If God wills" Discuss Now Two-division ONE MMA world champion Anatoly Malykhin [Photo via ONE Championship] Reigning ONE light heavyweight and middleweight MMA world champion Anatoly Malykhin has enjoyed enormous success since debuting in ONE Championship in March 2021. However, his biggest goal for the new year revolves around his family.
In an interview with the world's largest martial arts promotion, Malykhin shared that he and his wife Anita are hoping to have a second child, saying:
"Outside the ring, my wife and I hope to grow our family. If God wills, we'd love to have a second child." Trending Get the latest updates on One Championship Rankings at Sportskeeda and more
2024 was a landmark year for the 36-year-old Russian behemoth. He became the first fighter in ONE's history to hold three MMA world titles simultaneously when he claimed the 205-pound MMA crown from Dutch rival Reinier de Ridder at ONE 166: Qatar in March .
At ONE 169 on Nov. 8, Malykhin's reign over the heavyweight MMA division was challenged by Senegalese wrestling machine Oumar 'Reug Reug' Kane.
Though he showcased immense heart in their five-round war, the One Chance Team and Tiger Muay Thai fighter ultimately lost his 26 pounds of heavyweight MMA gold to Kane via split decision.
